articles.description: Coronavirus antibody tests have shown that asymptomatic patients are more likely to show low levels of COVID-19 antibodies in the bloodstream as soon as two to three months after the infection. Low levels of antibodies do not indicate an increased risk of rei…

articles.title: Hundreds of millions of COVID-19 vaccine doses available for 2021 - WHO - The Jerusalem Post
articles.description: “If we’re very lucky, there will be one or two successful [vaccine] candidates before the end of this year,” said Soumya Swaminathan, WHO chief scientist.
